content.user_title: Secure FastAPI APIs with JWT Authentication
content.value_statement: FastAPI APIs need secure authentication to protect endpoints and user data. This skill provides guidance on implementing JWT token validation, user identity verification, and role-based access control for REST APIs.
actual_capabilities: Extract and validate JWT tokens from Authorization headers
Verify token signatures and check expiration claims
Implement user-specific access control and authorization
Configure role-based access control (RBAC) for endpoints
Handle authentication errors with proper HTTP status codes
Integrate JWT authentication with FastAPI dependency injection
limitations: This is a conceptual skill providing implementation guidance, not a ready-to-use library
Does not include actual token generation or user database code
Requires user to implement the described patterns in their own codebase

use_cases.title: Implement Access Control

use_cases.title: Design Auth Systems

prompt_templates.title: Basic JWT Protection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the API JWT Authenticator skill to add JWT authentication to a FastAPI endpoint. Extract the Bearer token from the Authorization header, validate the signature using a secret key, verify expiration, and return user info or 401 error.

prompt_templates.title: User-Specific Access
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the JWT Authenticator pattern to ensure users can only access their own resources. Extract user_id from token payload, compare with resource owner, and return 403 if they do not match.

prompt_templates.title: Role-Based Permissions
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement role-based access control using the JWT Authenticator skill. Define admin, moderator, and user roles in token claims. Create dependencies that verify user role before allowing endpoint access.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Auth System
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a complete JWT authentication system for FastAPI following best practices from the API JWT Authenticator skill. Include token generation endpoint, protected routes, error handling, and production security considerations.

best_practices: Always use HTTPS in production to prevent token interception during transmission
Store secret keys in environment variables or secure vaults, never in source code
Set appropriate token expiration times to limit exposure windows for compromised tokens
anti_patterns: Do not expose raw JWT tokens in URLs or server logs as this enables token theft
Avoid storing sensitive information in JWT payloads since tokens can be decoded by anyone
Never skip token signature verification even in development or testing environments

faq.question: What Python libraries work with this skill?
faq.answer: Use python-jose for JWT encoding/decoding and passlib for password hashing. Both integrate well with FastAPI dependencies.

faq.question: How long should JWT tokens last?
faq.answer: Access tokens typically expire in 15-30 minutes for security. Use refresh tokens for longer sessions with proper rotation.

faq.question: Can I use this with microservices?
faq.answer: Yes. JWT is ideal for stateless microservices. Share secret keys or use public key cryptography for token verification across services.

faq.question: Is my token data encrypted?
faq.answer: JWT tokens are signed, not encrypted. Anyone can decode the payload. Never include sensitive data like passwords in tokens.

faq.question: Why is my token validation failing?
faq.answer: Check that clock time is synchronized on your server, verify the secret key matches exactly, and ensure tokens include required claims.

faq.question: How does this compare to session-based auth?
faq.answer: JWT is stateless and scales horizontally across services. Sessions require server storage but offer immediate revocation. Choose based on architecture needs.
